transportAdvice: San Sebastián's compact old town and beachfront areas are very walkable, making it easy to explore most attractions on foot. The city has a reliable local bus network covering tourist areas, and taxis are readily available throughout the city.

weather.description: Cool and frequently rainy with mild temperatures, typical of the Basque winter.
Similar to January with persistent rain and overcast skies, though days gradually lengthen.
Early spring brings slightly warmer days but rainfall remains frequent and skies often grey.
Mild and green with occasional sunny spells, though showers are still common throughout the month.
Pleasant spring weather with more sunshine, though expect some rainy days mixed in.
Warm and increasingly sunny, making it a good time to enjoy the beaches and outdoor dining.
The warmest and sunniest month, ideal for beach visits with long evenings and lively atmosphere.
Consistently warm and sunny, peak tourist season with beaches and pintxos bars at their busiest.
Warm and pleasant with fewer crowds than August, a favourite month for many visitors.
Autumn brings noticeably more rain and cooler temperatures as the Atlantic weather reasserts itself.
Cool and wet with frequent overcast days, though the city remains lively with local life.
Mild but rainy winter conditions return, with festive atmosphere in the city centre offsetting the grey skies.
